intro: Pleroma stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruited pleroma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal heathland and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a dense canopy that supports local wildlife. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
